item.title: Iceland: Kerid crater
item.description: (meta: pictures are not by me; this is not meant for public use per se) Prio MELLAN Sneak peek ğŸ”—What is it ğŸ”—Vulkanisk krater. Measures approximately (170 meters) in width with a circumference of (270 meters) and it is (55 meters) deep. Believed to be 3,000-year-old, which seems to be approximately half of the age of other volcanic calderas found in Iceland. The age difference of KeriÃ° Crater is the reason to why the slopes are in the hues of red rather than being volcanic black, while the iron deposits are extremely fresh in geological terms.
